poem:
Title: "In the Midst of Rights Marred"

In simple words,
a torn page of History
or Future - a tale yet spun,
that simple Act, 
of humanity entwined
in parchment and ink - 
To savour or scorn?

Labour's keep, the pledge of rights,
Stands against the stirring storm,
An apple, ripened in our grasp -
Crucial, seldom bright.
Should we not preserve it,
chaste and undismayed,
For those who wake tomorrow?
